meanings.definition: A stick with a pointed or electrically charged end, for driving cattle.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a goad to guide the cows to the pasture.
meanings.sent2: The sharp goad helped the rancher move the herd along.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to nibble on the goad, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The goad stood tall in the field, a silent shepherd to the wandering cattle.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming goad shimmered in the sunlight, a tool of gentle persuasion for the livestock.

meanings.definition: Provoke or annoy (someone) so as to stimulate some action or reaction.
meanings.sent1: His teasing words would often goad his little sister into chasing him around the yard.
meanings.sent2: The coach knew how to goad the team into giving their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy would goad the older dog into a game of chase around the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed acted as a goad, pushing her to work harder each day.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd served as a powerful goad for the athlete to reach the finish line.
